document_data.name: Chondath
document_data.mainbody:
'''Chondath''' was a country located in the [[Vilhon Reach]]. It had a long history. It was located on what once was the psiocracy of [[Jhaamdath]] on the shore of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]. Chondath was later a confederation of city-states under the capital of [[Arrabar]], but used to be a powerful nation in times long past.

All of Chondath was ruled by [[Eles Wianar]], the Lord of [[Arrabar]]. He resided in the [[Generon]], a large palace located in the capital.
document_data.Society: [[Chondathan]]s were primarily traders, often dealing with far-off lands. They were also a somewhat warlike people and distrusted [[wizard]]s and [[magic]] altogether.
document_data.Religion: [[Waukeen]], the goddess of trade, was heavily worshiped here. Other important gods were [[Helm]], god of guardians; [[Lliira]], goddess of joy; [[Malar]], god of the hunt; [[Talos]], god of storms; and [[Tempus]], god of war.
document_data.Culture: Traditional Chondathan chairs were constructed to have very distinct high backs.

Major Geographical Features.Chondalwood: A large forest south of Chondath that was inhabited by [[elves]], [[satyr]]s, and [[centaur]]s.

document_data.History:
[[File:Vilhon reach chondath yuan-ti maps.jpg|thumb]]
Chondath was a country with a fabled past, once the site of a mighty empire ruling over much of the [[Vilhon Reach]], [[Sembia]], and arguably [[Westgate]] all under the control of the Chondathan [[Illistine]] family. It was formed from a confederation of city-states in the {{YearlinkName|144}} during a brutal war with the elves of nearby [[Chondalwood]].<ref name = "GHotR-p63">

Continuing the war with elves, [[Chondath]] under the ruler [[Laviar Illistine]] sent a force of 10,000 soldiers into the [[Chondalwood]]. They are massacred, with scarce 200 soldiers returning alive.<ref name = "GHotR-p68">

Sometime before the {{YearlinkName|400}} the cities of Chondathan and Chauncelgaunt were founded by Chondathan colonists in [[Sembia]]. Over time these colonies became known as [[Saerloon]] and [[Selgaunt]], respectively.<ref name = "GHoTR-p73">

In the {{YearlinkName|472}} the Chondathan city of Mussum was hit by a mysterious plague, which killed more than three quarters of the population in less than a day, and the city was abandoned.<ref name = "GHoTR-p88">

Soon after, [[Hlondeth]] regained its independence from Chondath.<ref name = "GHoTR-p93">

Civil war broke out in Chondath in the {{YearlinkName|900}} and, following two years of bitter [[Rotting War]], the city-states of Chondathan, Chancelgaunt,<ref name = "GHoTR-p109" /> Following foul plagues imbued the magic of the lower planes sweeping across the empire, unleashed by the war, the Chondathan empire broke apart.<ref name = "GHoTR-p109">

''Circa'' [[1017 DR]], exodus of several grand mercenary companies from the Vilhon Reach elected to leave Chondath, being fed up by conflicts, wars, and bloodshed. The mercenaries though Chondath to be honor-less and along with their families, traveling hospitals, mobile sanctuaries, and courts, slowly traveled the continent until they reached the unclaimed lands on the north-western shores of the [[Akanamere]]. With time the yellow rolling hills and valleys of scattered ruins were turned into militaristic yet bloodless [[Blade Kingdoms]].{{Cite web/Presenting...Seven Millennia of Realms Fiction}}

Chondath regained some measure of its former power in the {{YearlinkName|1150}}, in part by lending mercenaries to the power struggles in [[Chessenta]]<ref name = "GHoTR-p121">

In the {{yearlinkName|1386}}, as part of the [[Spellplague]] unleashed the [[1385 DR|previous year]], great swaths of Chondath and western Chessenta were catastrophically exchanged with parts of the world of [[Abeir]], from the land of [[Shyr]].{{Cite dragon/362/Countdown to the Realms: Spellplague: The Wailing Years}} Several Chondathan cities were destroyed, left high on peaks or at the bottoms of ravines. Meanwhile, the draining of the Sea of the Fallen Stars lowered the sea level of Vilhon Reach, exposing new lands and Jhaamdathan ruins. Cities.Arrabar: The capital of Chondath was an ancient city with a large portion of Chondath's army.
Cities.Hlath: A busy port city that exported much of the region's lumber.
Cities.Shamph: This thriving city benefited greatly from the war between [[Hlath]] and [[Iljak]].
Cities.Mussum: This plague-ridden ruin was known for the [[House of Holy Suffering]] temple which lay near or in it.
